tournaments.description: The tournaments to include in this account.

format.description: The debating format used at this tournament (e.g. BP).

broke.description: Whether the debater broke at this tournament.

break_categories.description: The category or categories the speaker broke in.

rounds.description: All the rounds the debater participated in in this tournament.

name.description: The name of the round (e.g. 'round 1' or 'grand finals'.

outround.description: If this round was an outround.

outround_category.description: What speaker category this outround belongs to (e.g. open or ESL). Should only be used if the round is an outround.

prepped.description: Whether the round was a prepped round (if applicable).

date.description: The date at which this round took place. Should be an ISO date.

topics.description: Keywords relating to the topic of the debate (e.g. 'Politics').

infoslide.description: The infoslide attached to the motion.

side.description: The side of the motion the debater was on.

half.description: The half of the debate the debater was on. Only applies to BP.

team_mates.description: The teammate or teammates the speaker was debating with this round.

speech.description: The number of the speech the debater gave. Only counts speeches on the debater's side (e.g. in BP an opposition whip would be speech 4, not 8).

result.description: How many points the debater's team got from this round. In two-team formats, a 1 or 0 simply mean a win or loss, respectively. For more complex formats, such as BP, please refer to the format's manuals for how many points a certain result yields.

speak.description: The speak the debater got for this speech.
